reviewText:
The production is on the level of BBC and Masterpiece Theater literary programs.

For people like me unfamiliar with the history of post-WWI Ukraine, it's hard at first to tell who's who and what's going on.  It prompted me to read about the period, which is a good thing.  Helps understanding of current Russian-Ukraine divide.

Very well done, but at the same time very complicated plot that would be very difficult to decipher for those viewers with limited understanding of the history of Russia, Ukraine, Bolshevik revolution and so on. Complicated relationship between Russians and Ukrainians; this love-hate emotions on both sides of the nationalistic equation is craftily woven into the fabric of this great miniseries.
Fantastic show!  Highly recommend this miniseries.
Great book and movie! One of the movies your should see. Amazon sent it fast and I'm pleased with service. Thanks.

What an excellent series. The acting and narrative of this fascinating drama greatly enlightens not only a very critical period in the twentieth century history of the Ukraine, but sheds enlightenment on current events in the Crimea.
